meanings.definition: The condition of having four stamens arranged in two pairs of unequal length in a flower.
meanings.sent1: The didynamies of the flower made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the didynamies of various flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The didynamies of the flower seemed to give it a quirky personality.
meanings.sent4: The didynamies of the flower were like a dance of stamens in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the flower accentuated its didynamies.

meanings.definition: The presence of didynamous stamens in a plant.
meanings.sent1: The didynamies in the plant were a sign of its unique characteristics.
meanings.sent2: The gardener observed the didynamies in the plant with interest.
meanings.sent3: The didynamies in the plant made it stand out among the others.
meanings.sent4: The didynamies in the plant were like a secret code of nature.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the plant was enhanced by its didynamies.
